alert.note: Alert for Haines Borough and Lynn Canal (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 07 at 11:29PM AKST until February 08 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...The following areas, Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area, Haines Borough and the northern inner channels. This includes the cities of Yakutat, Skagway, And Haines. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of low-lying areas and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage areas due to clogged storm drains and ditches. Mariners should be monitor their vessels for proper water drainage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain may fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and reach critical levels.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
